thread.title: ‘The Kings of Big Spring’ Review: There’s Oil in Their Blood

author: Mimi Swartz
title: ‘The Kings of Big Spring’ Review: There’s Oil in Their Blood
text: Facing everything from flood fallout to sanctuary-city wars to President Trump’s plans to build that wall, Texas may be in a state of internal conflict, but no one can argue this isn’t a boom time for books about the place. Rodger D. Hodge’s “Texas Blood: Seven Generations Among the Outlaws, Ranchers, Indians, Missionaries, Soldiers, and Smugglers of the Borderlands” came out last fall, and this month Lawrence Wright’s much-anticipated “God Save Texas: A Journey into the Heart of the Lone Star State” will debut. The University of Texas Press will also be inaugurating their ambitious Texas Bookshelf series with Stephen...
